name: Cocoa House
description: West Africa's first skyscraper and a symbol of Ibadan's economic strength. Built in 1965, it now houses businesses, the Odu'a Museum, and heritage gallery.

name: Agodi Gardens
description: A serene public park with lush greenery, water features, a mini zoo, and recreational areas. Ideal for families and nature lovers.
address: Parliament Road, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: UI Zoological Garden (University of Ibadan Zoo)
description: A well-maintained zoo founded in 1948, home to lions, chimpanzees, birds, reptiles, and more. A top educational and leisure destination.
address: University of Ibadan, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: Bower's Tower
description: A historic monument built in 1936 in honor of Captain Bower. It offers panoramic views of Ibadan from the top of Oke-Are Hill.
address: Oke-Are, Ibadan North, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: Mapo Hall
description: A colonial-era structure built in 1929 that serves as Ibadan's city hall. It's a venue for cultural and civic events.
address: Mapo Hill, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: Ventura Mall
description: A modern shopping and entertainment complex with a cinema, arcade, shops, and restaurants â€” a hub of leisure and retail activity.
address: Sango-UI Road, Samonda, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: IITA Forest Reserve
description: Located within the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture, this reserve is a biodiversity hotspot perfect for eco-tourism, bird watching, and research.
address: IITA Campus, Moniya, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

name: Wole Soyinka Arts Theatre (UI)
description: Named after Nobel Laureate Wole Soyinka, this theatre hosts plays, musical performances, and cultural events, promoting arts and literature.
address: University of Ibadan, Arts Complex, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.
